1.text: Shall not wisdom call, and understanding give her voice?

2.text: She stood upon the head of the heights, upon the way of the house of the beaten paths.

3.text: At the hand of the gates, at the mouth of the city from the coming in of the doors she will cry:

4.text: To you, ye men, I shall call, and my voice is to the sons of man.

5.text: Understand craftiness, ye simple: and ye foolish, understand the heart.

6.text: Hear ye, for I will speak dear things; and the openings of my lips uprightnesses.

7.text: For my palate shall meditate the truth, and evil is the abomination of my lips.

8.text: In justice are all the sayings of my mouth; nothing in them crooked and perverse.

9.text: All of them straight to him understanding, and right to those finding knowledge.

10.text: Receive my instruction and not silver and knowledge above tried gold.

11.text: For wisdom is good above pearls, and all delights shall not be made equal with her.

12.text: I wisdom dwelt with prudence, and I shall find the knowledge of machinations.

13.text: The fear of Jehovah hates evil: pride and haughtiness, and the evil way, and the mouth of perverseness I hated.

14.text: To me counsel and wisdom: I am understanding; to me is strength.

15.text: By me kings shall reign, and princes shall decree justice.

16.text: By me chiefs shall have dominion, and nobles all judging the earth.

17.text: I loved those loving me: and they seeking me shall find me.

18.text: Riches and honor are with me; splendid riches and justice.

19.text: My fruit is good above gold, and above pure gold; and my gain above tried silver.

20.text: I shall go in the way of justice, in the midst of the beaten paths of judgment:

21.text: To cause those loving me to inherit existence: and I will fill their treasures.

22.text: Jehovah set me up the beginning of his way, before his works from ancient time.

23.text: From forever I was knit together, from the beginning, from the first of the earth.

24.text: In no depths was I begun; in no fountains abundant in waters.

25.text: Before the mountains were settled; before the hills I had a beginning:

26.text: Yet he made not the earth and the fields, and the head of the clods of the habitable globe.

27.text: In his preparing the heavens I was there: in his inscribing a circle upon the face of the deep:

28.text: In his making firm the clouds from above: in his strengthening the fountains of the deep:

29.text: In his setting his law to the sea, and the waters shall not pass by his mouth; in his making firm the foundations of the earth:

30.text: And I shall be near him the builder, and I shall be a delight of day, day, smiling before him in all time.

31.text: Smiling in the habitable globe of his earth; and my delight with the sons of man.

32.text: And now ye sons, hear to me: and the happy shall watch my ways.

33.text: Hear ye instructions, and be wise, and ye shall not reject it.

34.text: Happy the man hearing to me, to watch at my doors day, day; to watch the door posts of my entrances.

35.text: For he finding me, the finding of life, and he shall bring forth acceptance from Jehovah.

36.text: And he sinning against me did violence to his soul: all hating me loved death.
